Quick search

msutils¶

This module contains functionality for handling measurement-set files.

Reference¶

apercal.subs.msutils.add_caltables(ct, interp, addct, addinterp)[source]¶

Funtion to autimatically handle the adding of on-the-fly calibration table expressions in the CASA syntax

ct (string): Calibration table string interp (string): Interpolation string addct (string): Calibration table string to add addinterp (string): Interpolation string to add

returns(string, string): The updated calibration table string, the updated inteprolation string

apercal.subs.msutils.flip_ra(msname, logger=None, force=False)[source]¶

Flip RA about central pointing, stored in REFERENCE_DIR. Will not flip if it has been done already.

Args:
msname (str): full path to measurement set logger (Logger): logger to be used. If None, will print to stdout force (bool): also flip when it has been done already
Returns:
bool: True if ra has been flipped
apercal.subs.msutils.format_dir(dir_rad)[source]¶

Format an angle in ra, dec in sexagesimal format

Args:
dir_rad (Tuple[float, float]): Direction in ra, dec (in radians)
Returns:
str: formatted direction, e.g. 5h42m36.144s 49d51m07.2s
apercal.subs.msutils.get_nchan(msname)[source]¶

Get the number of channels from a Measurement Set

Args:
msname (str): full path to a Measurement Set
Returns:
int: number of channels (in first spectral window)
apercal.subs.msutils.get_source_name(msname)[source]¶

Get the source name from a Measurement Set

Args:
msname (str): full path to a Measurement Set
Returns:
str: Source name (e.g. 3C295)
apercal.subs.msutils.has_correcteddata(vis)[source]¶

Test if a corrected_data column exists vis(string): input MS file return(bool): True if corrected_data column exists, otherwise False

apercal.subs.msutils.has_good_modeldata(vis)[source]¶

Test whether a model column exists and is not only 1 or 0

Args:
vis (string): input MS file
Returns:
bool: True if ‘good’ model data exists
apercal.subs.msutils.ra_flipped(msname)[source]¶

Check if RA was already flipped by reading HISTORY subtable

Args:
msname: full path to measurement set
Returns:
bool: True if already flipped
